title: The Ride Cymbal
description: Learn to use the ride cymbal as a timekeeper and combine it with kick and snare.

steps.title: The Ride Cymbal
steps.description: The ride cymbal is a large cymbal used for keeping time, similar to the hi-hat but with a more open, shimmering sound. It's commonly used in jazz, ballads, and the quieter sections of rock songs. Switching from hi-hat to ride changes the entire feel of a beat.

steps.title: Hit the Ride
steps.description: Hit the ride cymbal (RDE). Listen to its sustained, shimmering tone.

steps.title: Ride + Kick
steps.description: Play the ride and kick together. This is the foundation of a jazz-style beat.

steps.title: Ride + Snare
steps.description: Play the ride and snare together for the backbeat with ride.

steps.title: Ride + Kick + Snare
steps.description: All three together â€” ride keeping time with both kick and snare. This is a full beat pattern.
steps.hint: Hit KCK, SNR, and RDE all at the same time.
